contentfulPagePressRelease.title: HBKU Welcomes First Class for Executive Master in Energy and Resources

childMarkdownRemark.html:
Hamad bin Khalifa University (HBKU) held a luncheon on 19 January welcoming the first admitted class for its Executive Master in Energy and Resources. The program is offered in partnership with Georgetown University – School of Foreign Service in Qatar, Texas A&M University at Qatar, and HEC Paris in Qatar.

The event, held at the HBKU Student Center, was attended by His Excellency Sheikh Abdulla bin Ali Al-Thani, PhD, President of Hamad bin Khalifa University, the deans of several HBKU partner universities, high profile executives from leading organizations, and honored guests.

Specially designed to create an in-depth understanding of the role of energy and resources in modern life, HBKU’s Executive Master in Energy and Resources will integrate the disciplines of geopolitics, public policy, technology, finance, management and strategy, and will prepare participants to conduct strategic analysis, reach effective decisions and manage their operations with a global understanding of E&R issues.

The students will go through five modules over a period of 16 months. Classes began on 25 January 2014.
